A companion to the [Photo Grid Demo](../photo-grid-demo/index.qmd), covering everything
else: wide photos, lightbox features, typography, tables, callouts, columns, layout
width classes, figure layouts, video embeds, asides, and more.

## Wide Photo

The `.photo-wide` class shows a single image at full content width with a max height of
500px. Good for hero-style shots within a post.

::: {.photo-wide}
![Pont Alexandre III at dusk](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1520939817895-060bdaf4fe1b?w=1200&auto=format&q=80){group="wide" description="Pont Alexandre III at dusk." width="1200" height="800"}
:::

## Lightbox Groups

All images on this site open in a lightbox when clicked. The `group` attribute links
images into a shared gallery so you can arrow between them. Different `group` values
create separate galleries on the same page.

The `description` attribute adds a caption in the lightbox overlay — visible when you
click any image on this page.

### Inline Formatting

| Syntax | Result |
|--------|--------|
| `**bold**` | **bold** |
| `*italic*` | *italic* |
| `***bold italic***` | ***bold italic*** |
| `~~strikethrough~~` | ~~strikethrough~~ |
| `^superscript^` | ^superscript^ |
| `~subscript~` | ~subscript~ |
| `` `inline code` `` | `inline code` |
| `[link text](url)` | [link text](https://example.com) |

## Code Blocks

Inline: use `quarto render` to build the site.

Fenced block with syntax highlighting:

```yaml
# _quarto.yml excerpt
format:
  html:
    theme:
      - default
      - moving.scss
    css: styles.css
    lightbox: true
```

```css
/* Column modifier — 3 columns */
.photo-grid.cols-3 {
    grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr);
}
```

## Horizontal Rule

Content above the rule.

* * *

Content below the rule. Use `* * *` in Quarto — not `---`, which is interpreted as
a YAML delimiter.

## Math

Inline math: the focal length and aperture relationship is $N = f / D$ where $N$ is the
f-number, $f$ is focal length, and $D$ is the entrance pupil diameter.

Display math:

$$
\text{Exposure Value} = \log_2\!\left(\frac{N^2}{t}\right)
$$

where $N$ is the f-number and $t$ is exposure time in seconds.

## Layout Width Classes

Quarto provides built-in classes to push content beyond the default body width.
These work without any custom CSS.

### Body Outset

Slightly wider than the body column — good for a photo that deserves a bit more room.

:::{.column-body-outset}
![Tuileries Garden](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1524396309943-e03f5249f002?w=1400&auto=format&q=80){group="layout" description="Tuileries Garden — body outset width."}
:::

### Page Width

Spans the full page width (including margins), wider than body outset.

:::{.column-page}
![Champs-Élysées lights](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1545622783-b3e021430fee?w=1600&auto=format&q=80){group="layout" description="Champs-Élysées — page width."}
:::

### Screen Width

Edge-to-edge, filling the entire browser window.

:::{.column-screen}
![Shibuya crossing](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1542051841857-5f90071e7989?w=1600&auto=format&q=80){group="layout" description="Shibuya crossing — full screen width."}
:::

## Figure Layouts

The `layout` attribute arranges multiple images in custom grid patterns — more
flexible than `.photo-grid` for asymmetric arrangements.

Two equal images side by side:

::: {layout="[1,1]"}
![Montmartre](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1550340499-a6c60fc8287c?w=600&auto=format&q=80){group="fig-layout" description="Montmartre streets."}

![Café](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1514933651103-005eec06c04b?w=600&auto=format&q=80){group="fig-layout" description="Corner café."}
:::

Two rows — two images on top, one spanning below:

::: {layout="[[1,1],[1]]"}
![Louvre at night](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1499856871958-5b9627545d1a?w=600&auto=format&q=80){group="fig-layout" description="The Louvre pyramid."}

![Eiffel Tower](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1460904577954-8fadb262612c?w=600&auto=format&q=80){group="fig-layout" description="Eiffel Tower from Trocadéro."}

![Seine bookstalls](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1500039436846-25ae2f11882e?w=1200&auto=format&q=80){group="fig-layout" description="Bouquinistes along the Seine."}
:::

Uneven widths — one-third / two-thirds split:

::: {layout="[1,2]"}
![Pastries](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1509440159596-0249088772ff?w=400&auto=format&q=80){group="fig-layout" description="Morning pastries."}

![Rooftops](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1431274172761-fca41d930114?w=800&auto=format&q=80){group="fig-layout" description="Parisian rooftops."}
:::
